intro: Thlaspi fendleri var. idahoense, commonly known as Idaho pennycress, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in Idaho and surrounding regions. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and alpine environments, thriving in cooler climates. It produces small, yellow flowers and has a compact, low-growing habit. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in a fine layer of wax.
